summary: "Finding Nemo" is a popular 2003 animated movie from Pixar. It follows Marlin, an overprotective clownfish, and Dory, a forgetful blue tang, as they search for Marlin's missing son, Nemo. The film is inspired by director Andrew Stanton's love for fish tanks as a child. To make the fish movements realistic, animators studied fish biology. The movie was a huge success, making over $871 million worldwide. It won an Academy Award for Best Animated Feature and is the best-selling DVD of all time. A sequel, "Finding Dory," came out in 2016.
title: Finding Nemo
